meanings.definition: To make a sudden charge or attack.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight was sallying forth to face the dragon.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were sallying out of their camp to surprise the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was sallying up the tree, trying to avoid the mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: The waves sallying against the shore reminded her of the relentless passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The fearless hero sallying into battle became a legend in the land.

meanings.sent1: The sudden sallying of the enemy caught us off guard.
meanings.sent2: The knight's sallying towards the castle was swift and unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful sallying at the mouse made the whole room burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sallying of the storm upon the town left chaos in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The pirate's sallying for treasure was met with fierce resistance.

meanings.sent1: Her sallying at the dinner table always brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's sallying during the show had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent3: His sallying about the weather made even the grumpiest person chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The politician's sallying during the debate caught his opponent off guard.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's sallying in class made learning fun and engaging.
